title: Applied Cryptography as an elective in EC Campus
content: How is the faculty in the EC Campus and the subject overall in scoring in isa/esa + assignments?

comments.body:
ISAs were very easy. All MCQs but each ISA contributes only 10% to the total marking. Personally, I felt ESA was tougher compared to PYQ.. also because I did not go through much of the theoretical parts for ISA (as mcqs were easy to guess). ESAs are still manageable and you can get A easily if you show some interest. You will have to work hard on Labs and Hackathons as many of my peers lost marks there.

Overall the subject is scoring and fun provided you like logic and little math. If you are into cybersec this is the best elective for you. However if you are into ML and data field I would suggest you to take DA.
Bro I am into ml field but will it be fine if I take up AC and big data??

It's totally fine. I took AC and BD â€” both courses are really good. I only mentioned DA because it gives more direct insights into ML-related projects. But you can always learn DA concepts online if you're interested.
